---
layout:         post-mbed-org
title:          "Live Webinar : Rapid Prototype & Development of USB Connected Devices Using mbed and LPCXpresso"
date:           2012-06-08T13:25:52.000Z
author:         Amit Naran
tags:           avnet, nxp, webinar
originalUrl:    https://developer.mbed.org/blog/entry/Live-Webinar--Rapid-Prototype--Developme/
---

<p>Jim Carver (Avnet Electronics) and Paul Boogaards (NXP Semiconductors),
  two specialists in microcontrollers and embedded development, are going
  to present a free live webinar about rapid prototyping including a walk-through
  of adding USB connectivity to designs using the LPC11U24.</p>
<p>
  <img width="120" alt="Webinar" title="Webinar" src="https://developer.mbed.org/media/uploads/anaran/120xNxwebinar.jpg.pagespeed.ic.IhCpYBTwLt.jpg">
</p>
<table>
  <tr>
    <td>
      <img width="90" alt="NXP" title="NXP" src="data:image/png;base64,">
    </td>
    <td>
      <img width="120" alt="Avnet" title="Avnet" src="data:image/png;base64,">
    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<p><u>The Agenda</u>
</p>
<ul>
  <li>Introduction to the mbed online tools</li>
  <li>Application example
    <ul>
      <li>Porting code from an 8051 design to mbed while adding USB connectivity</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
  <li>Migrating from mbed to LPCXpresso</li>
  <li>Using NXP ROM drivers to enable USB connectivity</li>
</ul>
<p><u>Local US times</u>
</p>
<table>
  <tr>
    <td>Greenwich Mean Time</td>
    <td>Tue, Jun 26, 2012</td>
    <td>18:00</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>Eastern Daylight Time</td>
    <td>Tue, Jun 26, 2012</td>
    <td>14:00</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>Pacific Daylight Time</td>
    <td>Tue, Jun 26, 2012</td>
    <td>11:00</td>
  </tr>
</table>
<p>It will be a good overview of development with mbed, LPCXpresso and the
  NXP USB ROM drivers. Attendees will also receive an exclusive offer to
  purchase discounted baseboards from the Avnet Store.</p>
<p>You can find out more and register for the webinar <a href="http://seminar2.techonline.com/registration/wcIndex.cgi?sessionID=avnet_jun2612"
  rel="nofollow">here</a>.</p>
